page.title: 12FARRINGDON SCHOOL
page.content: Originally Farringdon School was in the eastern part of the village in a building now called The Old School House. But in the late 1920's the school transferred to its present site, part of Massey's Folly. In 1984 Farringdon and Selborne Primary Schools officially merged becoming known as Bushdown Primary School. Merger was due to low numbers but it was decided to keep both buildings open. The headteacher is Mrs. Ann Bamford, based at Selborne, with Mrs.Grant and Mrs. Lodder teaching at Farringdon.
